summary: The Weather Workforce Improvement Act aims to expedite the hiring process for critical National Weather Service positions, focusing on public safety. It grants the Director of the National Weather Service direct hire authority for specific roles such as meteorologists, scientists, and technicians. The bill also mandates workforce assessments, including hiring timelines, staffing needs, and the health impacts of shift work, along with recommendations for improvement. This legislation amends the Weather Research and Forecasting Innovation Act of 2017.
